item.title: 据 The Information 报道，软银将向 OpenAI 投资 5 亿美元
item.description: 据 The Information 周一援引一位熟悉该交易的人士的话报道，日本电信公司软银将向 OpenAI 的最新一轮融资投资 5 亿美元。【原文：Japanese telecom company SoftBank will invest $500 million in OpenAI's latest funding round, The Information reported on Monday, citing a person familiar with the deal.】

item.title: 第三季度市场 "过山车 "式的日元刺激与石油泄漏
item.description: 对市场而言，这是一个多么疯狂的季度！日元创下自 2008 年全球金融危机以来的最强劲表现，各国央行高速旋转，石油跳水，黄金大放异彩，中国大举刺激经济。【原文：What a wild quarter for the markets! The yen's strongest run since the 2008 global crash, central banks swivelling at speed, oil diving, gold shining and China spraying economic stimulus.】

item.title: 飓风 "海伦 "导致停电，需求减少，美国天然气价格缓和
item.description: 美国天然气期货周一下跌约 1%，原因是上周末产量略有增加，而且据预测，未来两周的需求将低于此前预期。【原文：U.S. natural gas futures eased about 1% on Monday on a small increase in output over the weekend and forecasts for less demand over the next two weeks than previously expected.】

item.title: 美国制定新规则，可能推动人工智能芯片进入中东地区
item.description: 美国商务部周一发布的一份政府公告称，美国商务部为海外数据中心提供了一项无需个人许可证即可获得人工智能芯片的计划。【原文：The U.S. Commerce Department offered a program on Monday for overseas data centers to get AI chips without individual licenses, according to a government posting.】

item.title: 俄罗斯因违禁内容对谷歌和 Discord 罚款
item.description: 莫斯科法院新闻处称，俄罗斯周一对 Alphabet 旗下的谷歌和即时通讯平台 Discord 处以罚款，原因是它们未能删除或限制访问网上信息。【原文：Russia fined Alphabet's Google and instant messaging platform Discord on Monday for failing to delete or restrict access to information online, the Moscow courts' press service said.】

item.title: 本周数据密集，华尔街开局走低；期待鲍威尔的言论
item.description: 华尔街周一将低开，因为投资者在经历了前一周的反弹后暂停投资，并在本周众多就业报告和包括美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔在内的美联储政策制定者发表评论之前保持谨慎。【原文：Wall Street was set for a lower open on Monday as investors paused after a rally in the previous week and exercised caution ahead of numerous job reports and comments through the week from Federal Reserve policymakers, including Chair Jerome Powell.】

item.title: 共和党的顶级银行链桥银行在美国首次公开募股中寻求高达 480 万美元的投资
item.description: Chain Bridge Bancorp 是一家自成立以来就深受共和党人欢迎的贷款公司，它的目标是在美国首次公开募股中筹集高达 4810 万美元的资金。【原文：Chain Bridge Bancorp, a lender popular among Republicans since its inception, is aiming to raise up to $48.1 million in its initial public offering in the United States.】

item.title: 福特将在年底前为电动汽车买家提供免费充电器
item.description: 福特公司周一表示，该公司将在今年年底前向电动汽车购买者提供免费的家用充电器和安装服务，以吸引对电动汽车感兴趣的人。【原文：Ford is trying to woo the electric vehicle-curious by offering free home chargers and installation to buyers of EVs through the end of the year, the company said on Monday.】

item.title: 雅培、利洁时因早产婴儿配方奶粉面临审判，医生对此表示震惊
item.description: 一位密苏里州的母亲和她的律师本周将试图说服陪审团，雅培公司、利洁时公司旗下的美赞臣公司和圣路易斯儿童医院应该为她早产的儿子在医院出生后因这些公司的配方奶粉而引发的严重肠道疾病负责。【原文：A Missouri mother and her lawyers this week will aim to convince a jury that Abbott , Reckitt's Mead Johnson and St. Louis Children's Hospital are responsible for a severe intestinal illness that she says her premature son got from the companies' formulas after he was born at the hospital.】

item.title: 无论输赢，谷歌广告技术审判结果都不是致命一击
item.description: 在谷歌被指控非法垄断广告技术的审判接近尾声之际，专家表示，对于这家以搜索引擎闻名的科技巨头来说，败诉的财务风险微乎其微。【原文：As Google's trial on allegations of building an illegal monopoly in advertising technology nears its close, experts said the financial risk of losing the case is minimal for the tech giant best known for its search engine.】

item.title: 裕信银行和德国商业银行的五张图表
item.description: 意大利联合信贷银行（UniCredit）首席执行官 Andrea Orcel 和德国商业银行（Commerzbank）指定负责人 Bettina Orlopp 举行了第一轮会谈，意大利银行正在努力探索合作事宜，而德国银行则在准备辩护。【原文：UniCredit chief executive officer Andrea Orcel and Commerzbank's designated chief Bettina Orlopp have held a first round of talks as the Italian bank presses to explore a tie-up and the German bank readies its defence.】

item.title: Partners Group 支持的 KinderCare 在寻求已久的美国 IPO 中寻求最高 31 亿美元的估值
item.description: 周一，儿童早期教育提供商 KinderCare Learning Companies 为其寻求已久的美国首次公开募股设定了最高 30.9 亿美元的估值目标。【原文：KinderCare Learning Companies, a provider of early childhood education, set a target of up to $3.09 billion valuation on Monday for its long-sought U.S. initial public offering.】

item.title: DirecTV 达成与 Dish 合并的长期协议
item.description: DirecTV 周一同意收购 EchoStar 旗下包括 Dish TV 在内的卫星电视业务，结束了数十年来断断续续的谈判，从而成为美国最大的付费电视分销商之一，合并后将拥有 2000 万用户。【原文：DirecTV on Monday agreed to buy EchoStar's satellite television business that includes Dish TV, capping decades of on-and-off talks to create one of the nation's largest pay TV distributors with a combined 20 million subscribers.】

item.title: 美国大型石油公司披露向外国政府支付巨额款项
item.description: 根据监管文件显示，美国三大能源开采公司去年向外国政府支付了超过 420 亿美元，约为其在美国支付金额的八倍。【原文：The three largest U.S. energy exploration companies paid more than $42 billion to foreign governments last year, about eight times more than what they paid in the United States, according to regulatory filings.】

item.title: 聚焦：拉美亚马逊网站的竞争对手 MercadoLibre 借助人工智能、贷款和无人机高歌猛进
item.description: 当瓦格纳-迪亚斯（Wagner Dias）和他的妻子玛丽安娜（Mariana）需要贷款来发展他们的童装业务时，这对巴西企业家求助于阿根廷的 MercadoLibre Inc，这是他们用来销售产品的在线平台。【原文：When Wagner Dias and his wife Mariana needed a loan to grow their children's clothes business, the Brazilian entrepreneurs turned to Argentina's MercadoLibre Inc , the online platform they use to sell their products.】

item.title: 耐克将公布自 COVID 以来最大幅度的销售下滑，分析师预计目标将重新设定
item.description: 投资者和分析师预计，耐克将在本周二发布季度财报时下调年度预期，这是该公司自本月初宣布新任首席执行官以来发布的首份财报。【原文：Investors and analysts expect Nike to lower annual forecasts on Tuesday when it posts quarterly results, the company's first earnings report since announcing a new CEO earlier this month.】

item.title: 因需求和欧佩克不确定性，石油预测连续第五个月下调
item.description: 路透社周一的一项民意调查显示，分析师连续第五个月下调了2024年的油价预期，理由是需求疲软和欧佩克计划的不确定性，尽管存在地缘政治风险，但预计油价仍将承压。【原文：Analysts have cut their 2024 oil price forecasts for a fifth consecutive month, citing weaker demand and uncertainty over OPEC’s plans, with prices expected to remain under pressure despite geopolitical risks, a Reuters poll found on Monday.】

item.title: 欧洲汽车制造商因需求疲软、成本上升而发出利润预警
item.description: 欧洲汽车制造商斯泰兰特周一与更大的竞争对手大众汽车和其他公司一道，就汽车需求前景恶化和成本上升发出警告，使该行业的市值减少了数十亿欧元。【原文：European carmaker Stellantis joined on Monday bigger rival Volkswagen and others in warning about the worsening outlook for auto demand and rising costs, wiping billions of euros off the sector's market value.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，Verizon 接近达成向 Vertical Bridge 出售通信塔的交易
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周一援引知情人士的话报道，威瑞森通信公司（Verizon Communications）正在就向数字基础设施公司 Vertical Bridge 出售数千个移动电话塔进行深入谈判。【原文：Verizon Communications is in advanced talks to sell thousands of mobile phone towers to digital infrastructure firm Vertical Bridge, Bloomberg News reported on Monday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 早间新闻鲍威尔为第三季度画上句号，中国股市大涨 8
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 美国将公布更多太阳能关税两项决定中的第一项
item.description: 美国贸易官员本周可能会对来自东南亚四国的太阳能电池板征收新的关税，美国制造商曾抱怨这些国家采用了不公平的补贴措施，使美国产品缺乏竞争力。【原文：U.S. trade officials this week may impose new tariffs on solar panels from four Southeast Asian nations that American manufacturers have complained employ unfair subsidies that make U.S. products uncompetitive.】

item.title: 必和必拓预计 2035 年前铜需求每年将增长 100 万吨
item.description: 澳大利亚矿业公司必和必拓预计，由于采用铜密集型技术，到 2035 年，全球平均每年将多消耗 100 万吨铜，比过去 15 年的年增长率高出一倍。【原文：Australian miner BHP expects the world to consume an extra 1 million metric tons of copper per year on average until 2035 due to the adoption of copper-intensive technologies, double the annual volume growth in the past 15 years.】

item.title: AT&T 以 76 亿美元向 TPG 出售 DirecTV 70% 的股份
item.description: AT&T 周一表示，它将以 76 亿美元的价格向私募股权公司 TPG 出售其在卫星电视服务 DirecTV 中持有的 70% 股份，从而退出这项对这家电信运营商来说以分配额下降为标志的业务。【原文：AT&T said on Monday it would sell its 70% stake in satellite TV service DirecTV to private equity firm TPG for $7.6 billion, exiting a business marked by declining distributions for the telecom operator.】

item.title: 投资者连续第五周抛售美国股票基金
item.description: 截至9月25日，投资者连续第五周减持美国股票基金，原因是对经济健康状况的担忧挥之不去，以及在美国总统大选前的谨慎态度。【原文：Investors reduced holdings in U.S. equity funds for the fifth consecutive week through Sept. 25, driven by lingering concerns about the economy's health and caution ahead of the U.S. presidential election.】

item.title: 斯特兰蒂斯发出警告后，欧洲汽车股损失 100 亿美元
item.description: 欧洲汽车股周一暴跌近 4%，此前斯太尔、大众汽车和阿斯顿汽车发出的预警再次引发了市场对该行业在需求放缓和中国激烈竞争的环境下盈利前景的担忧。【原文：European auto stocks tumbled almost 4% on Monday after a warning from Stellantis, Volkswagen and Aston rekindled concerns over the sector's earnings outlook in a year marred by slowing demand and aggressive Chinese competition.】

item.title: 聚焦：波音供应商担心罢工会长期影响就业
item.description: 波音公司为期两周的罢工迫使航空航天供应商开拓者制造公司（Pathfinder Manufacturing）解雇了公司 54 名员工中的 14 名，公司首席执行官戴夫-特雷德（Dave Trader）担心，如果罢工持续下去，他可能需要让更多的员工回家。【原文：Boeing's two-week-old strike has forced aerospace supplier Pathfinder Manufacturing to furlough 14 out of the company's 54 employees, and CEO Dave Trader fears he may need to send more home if the stoppage grinds on.】

item.title: 聚焦：摩根大通 "杰米溢价 "面临考验，首席执行官继任迫在眉睫
item.description: 摩根大通首席执行官杰米-戴蒙（Jamie Dimon）的继任者是谁，何时继任，这些问题悬而未决，但分析师和投资者说，有一件事几乎可以肯定：当这位强势的银行总裁最终离任时，摩根大通的股价将会下滑。【原文：Questions hang over who will succeed JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon and when, but analysts and investors say one thing is almost certain: the bank's stock will slump when the powerful bank chief eventually departs.】

item.title: 投资者谨慎促使全球货币市场基金流入
item.description: 由于投资者对美国经济的健康状况持谨慎态度，并担心今年进一步降息可能预示着更严重的经济问题，全球货币市场基金出现了近六个月来最高的单周流入量。【原文：Global money market funds experienced their highest weekly inflows in nearly six months, with investors cautious about the health of the U.S. economy and concerned that further rate cuts this year could signal deeper economic troubles.】

item.title: DNeX 与谷歌云签署多年协议，在马来西亚提供主权云服务
item.description: 马来西亚技术公司 Dagang NeXchange Berhad（DNeX）和谷歌云（Google Cloud）周一宣布达成一项多年协议，在该国提供主权云服务。【原文：Malaysian technology firm Dagang NeXchange Berhad (DNeX) and Google Cloud on Monday announced a multi-year deal to provide sovereign cloud services in the country.】

item.title: Epic Games 指责三星和谷歌计划封杀应用程序竞争对手
item.description: "堡垒之夜》视频游戏制造商 Epic Games 周一指控 Alphabet 旗下的谷歌和全球最大的安卓手机制造商三星合谋保护谷歌的 Play 商店免受竞争。【原文：“Fortnite” video game maker Epic Games on Monday accused Alphabet’s Google and Samsung , the world’s largest Android phone manufacturer, of conspiring to protect Google’s Play store from competition.】
